title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona to move for Adeyemi
description: Borussia Dortmund forward Karim Adeyemi is on the radar of Barcelona ahead of next season. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

description: Ketua MPR Ahmad Muzani dorong BPK untuk tingkatkan efektivitas program pemerintahan Prabowo Subianto.

description: Kementerian Perindustrian (Kemenperin) mencatat lulusan vokasi binaan Kemenperin yang langsung diterima kerja di sektor ...

title: Purbaya Bakal Kucurkan Dana ke Pemda, Bank Jakarta Kebagian Rp20 Triliun
description: Kemenkeu akan melakukan penempatan dana saldo anggaran lebih (SAL) di Bank Jakarta.  Nilai dana yang akan dikucurkan sekitar Rp10 triliun hingga Rp20 triliun.

title: Penumpang di Bandara Ngurah Rai Naik Drastis Efek GP Mandalika
description: AJANG balap internasional MotoGP Mandalika 2025 telah berhasil digelar di Sirkuit Internasional Pertamina Mandalika, Lombok, Nusa Tenggara Barat, pada Minggu (5/10).

title: Plafon Masjid Islamic Center Serpong Roboh Diterpa Angin
description: Plafon Masjid Islamic Center di Serpong roboh imbas diterpa angin saat hujan deras.

title: 2 Pohon Tumbang Tutup Akses Jalan di Pondok Aren Tangsel, 1 Orang Terluka
description: 2 Pohon Tumbang Tutup Akses Jalan di Pondok Aren Tangsel, 1 Orang Terluka #newsupdate #update #news #text

title: Ketua Komisi IV DPR RI tinjau pelaksanaan MBG di Kota Yogyakarta
description: ANTARA - Ketua Komisi IV DPR RI Siti Hediati Hariyadi meninjau pelaksanaan pemberian Makan Bergizi Gratis di ...

title: Hotman Paris Pamerkan Reputasi Ahli Hukum dalam Kasus Budi Gunawan di Praperadilan Nadiem
description: Dalam sidang praperadilan Nadiem Makarim, reputasi ahli hukum diuji oleh Hotman Paris. Simak momen menariknya!

title: Lomba membatik, jadi ajang untuk mengenalkan batik ke generasi muda
description: ANTARA - Museum Batik Pekalongan menggelar Lomba Membatik Tingkat SMA/SMK/MA se-Jawa Tengah, Selasa (7/10), sebagai ajang memperkenalkan batik kepada generasi muda. Kegiatan tersebut diikuti oleh puluhan pelajar dari berbagai daerah seperti Batang, Magelang, Surakarta dan Wonosobo. (Yusup Fatoni/Yovita Amalia/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Gandeng Amerika, BPOM tingkatkan standar keamanan dan mutu obat
description: ANTARA - Badan Pengawas Obat dan Makanan (BPOM) memperkuat kolaborasi bersama United States Pharmacopeia (USP) guna meningkatkan mutu obat nasional. Deputi Bidang Pengawasan Obat, Narkotika, Prekursor, dan Zat Adiktif BPOM, William Adi Teja, Selasa (7/10), mengatakan bahwa sinergi tersebut juga menjadi upaya BPOM menuju pengakuan WHO Listed Authority (WLA). (Cahya Sari/Andi Bagasela/Roy Rosa Bachtiar)

title: Hadapi potensi banjir dan longsor, Temanggung tingkatkan siaga
description:
ANTARA - Kesiapsiagaan menghadapi musim penghujan ditingkatkan oleh Pemerintah Kabupaten Temanggung, Jawa Tengah. Kolaborasi lintas sektor dilakukan untuk memastikan penanganan cepat jika terjadi bencana. Pemerintah juga menyiapkan tambahan peralatan berat guna mempercepat proses tanggap darurat.
(Firman Eko Handy/Yovita Amalia/I Gusti Agung Ayu N)

title: Pemerintah pastikan integrasi ekonomi digital ASEAN lewat DEFA
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah mempercepat finalisasi ASEAN Digital Economic Framework Agreement (DEFA) untuk memperkuat integrasi ekonomi digital di kawasan. Menko Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto di Jakarta, Selasa (7/10) mengungkapkan kesepakatan ini diharapkan mampu menggandakan nilai ekonomi digital ASEAN hingga mencapai 2 triliun dollar AS pada 2030.(Putri Hanifa/Irfansyah Naufal Nasution/Andi Bagasela/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Negosiasi dagang RI-AS tertunda akibat adanya penutupan pemerintahan
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah Indonesia menunda sementara negosiasi dengan Amerika Serikat akibat dampak shutdown atau penutupan pemerintahan di Washington. Menko Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto di Jakarta, Selasa (7/10), menjelaskan proses pembahasan akan dilanjutkan setelah situasi di AS kembali normal. (Putri Hanifa/Irfansyah Naufal Nasution/Yovita Amalia/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Salurkan bantuan beras, Pemkot Pangkalpinang sasar 2.500 penerima
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah Kota (Pemkot) Pangkalpinang memberikan bantuan beras cadangan pemerintah daerah di Kota Pangkalpinang, pada Selasa (7/10). Total bantuan beras cadangan pemerintah daerah tahun 2025 ini menyasar sebanyak 2.500 penerima yang  belum pernah menerima bantuan pangan dalam enam bulan terakhir. (Chandrika Purnama Dewi/Andi Bagasela/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: BPOM pastikan obat batuk yang sebabkan kematian di India tak ada di RI
description: ANTARA - Badan Pengawas Obat dan Makanan (BPOM) memastikan obat batuk sirup Coldrif yang diduga menyebabkan kematian anak di India tak beredar di Indonesia. Deputi Bidang Pengawasan Obat, Narkotika, Prekursor, dan Zat Adiktif BPOM, William Adi Teja, Selasa (7/10), memastikan pengawasan ketat tetap dilakukan di seluruh farmasi dalam negeri. (Cahya Sari/Andi Bagasela/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Gelombang tinggi, BPBD Ternate imbau warga pesisir evakuasi mandiri
description: ANTARA - Badan Penanggulangan Bencana Daerah (BPBD) Kota Ternate, Maluku Utara, mengimbau para warga yang bermukim di pesisir pantai, untuk sementara waktu melakukan evakuasi mandiri ke tempat yang aman. Imbauan tersebut dikeluarkan Kepala BPBD Kota Ternate, Ferry Hamdany pada Selasa (7/10), menyusul adanya gelombang tinggi yang menerjang pemukiman wilayah pesisir hingga membuat air laut masuk ke dalam rumah warga. (Harmoko Minggu/Andi Bagasela/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: BNPB sebut seluruh jenazah korban Ponpes Al Khoziny telah ditemukan
description: ANTARA -Badan Nasional Penanggulangan Bencana (BNPB), Selasa (7/10), memperkirakan telah menemukan seluruh korban meninggal dunia yang tertimbun reruntuhan Pondok Pesantren Al Khoziny di Kabupaten Sidoarjo, Jawa Timur. Sejauh ini menurut data BNPB, total ada 63  jenazah yang berhasil dievakuasi, yang terdiri dari 61 jenazah utuh dan 7 potongan tubuh.(Rina Nur Anggraini/Rizky Bagus Dhermawan/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Festival Nyao Fufu, tradisi warga pesisir Ternate masuk Rekor MURI
description: ANTARA - Festival Nyao Fufu atau Ikan Asap merupakan sebuah tradisi yang dijalankan warga Kelurahan Dufa-dufa di Kota Ternate, Maluku Utara. Dalam acara yang digelar pada Senin (6/10) festival ini tercatat dan masuk dalam rekor Museum Rekor Dunia Indonesia (MURI),  karena ikan cakalang yang diolah mencapai jumlah sebanyak 6 ton atau lebih dari 5.000 ekor (Harmoko Minggu/Soni Namura/Rinto A Navis)

title: Kasus ponpes ambruk, Polda Jatim tegaskan proses hukum tetap berjalan
description: ANTARA - Kepolisian Daerah Jawa Timur (Polda Jatim) menyatakan saat ini fokus membantu proses pencarian dan identifikasi korban bangunan ambruk di Pondok Pesantren (Ponpes) Al Khoziny Sidoarjo. Barulah setelah itu dilakukan penegakan hukum. (Hanif Nasrullah/Soni Namura/Rinto A Navis)

title: Dari 8 kantong jenazah teridentifikasi 7 santri Ponpes Al Khoziny
description: ANTARA - Tim Disaster Victim Investigation Kepolisian Daerah Jawa Timur (DVI Polda Jatim) mengidentifikasi tujuh jenazah santri yang menjadi korban ambruknya bangunan di Pondok Pesantren (Ponpes) Al Khoziny Sidoarjo, Senin (6/10). Tujuh jenazah tersebut berasal dari delapan kantong jenazah. (Hanif Nasrullah/Fahrul Marwansyah/Gracia Simanjuntak)

title: PSDKP hentikan reklamasi tak berizin di Pulau Durai, Karimun
description: ANTARA - Tindakan tegas dijatuhkan untuk sebuah perusahaan yang melakukan reklamasi di Pulau Durai, Kabupaten Karimun, Kepulauan Riau. Mulai Senin (6/10) kawasan tersebut disegel dan seluruh kegiatan dihentikan sementara karena pengerjaan reklamasi yang sudah berjalan empat bulan ternyata dilakukan tanpa izin alias ilegal. ​​​(Rinto A Navis/Angiela Chantiequ/Agha Yuninda Maulana/Rinto A Navis)

title: Taman hiburan baru jadi simbol pertumbuhan ekonomi
description: ANTARA - Ghana terus memperkuat sektor pariwisatanya melalui pembangunan Bright International Amusement Park di Afienya. Taman hiburan dengan berbagai fasilitas modern ini akan menjadi destinasi baru bagi warga dan wisatawan kawasan Afrika Barat. Proyek tersebut juga sejalan dengan program ekonomi 24 jam yang tengah dijalankan pemerintah untuk meningkatkan aktivitas ekonomi nasional. (XINHUA/I Gusti Agung Ayu N/Agha Yuninda Maulana/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Mobil hemat energi dan ramah lingkungan karya mahasiswa Unej
description: ANTARA - Universitas Jember (Unej) meluncurkan dua mobil hemat energi dan ramah lingkungan karya mahasiswa Fakultas Teknik, yakni Wilabrata DV (Diesel Vehicle) dan Basundara E-Kart (Gokart Listrik) demi mendukung teknologi dan inovasi energi terbarukan, Senin (6/10). Kedua mobil tersebut menjadi simbol transisi menuju teknologi yang lebih efisien dan ramah lingkungan. (Hamka Agung Balya/Fahrul Marwansyah/Gracia Simanjuntak)

title: Angin kencang terjadi lagi di Jember, robohkan pohon dan timpa mobil
description: ANTARA - Angin kencang terjadi berulang dalam sepekan terakhir di sejumlah wilayah di Kabupaten Jember, Jawa Timur. Pada Senin sore (6/10) angin kencang menumbangkan sebuah pohon besar di tepi jalan penghubung Jember-Bondowoso. Sejak 29 September-6 Oktober,  sebanyak 3 mobil dan 1 truk tertimpa pohon yang roboh akibat angin kencang. (Hamka Agung Balya/Agha Yuninda Maulana/Rinto A Navis)

title: BGN percepat penerbitan SLHS bagi SPPG di daerah
description: ANTARA - Kepala Badan Gizi Nasional (BGN) Dadan Hindayana mengungkapkan dalam waktu sebulan ke depan semua Satuan Pelayanan Pemenuhan Gizi (SPPG) harus memiliki Sertifikat Laik Higiene Sanitasi (SLHS) untuk menjamin mutu pelaksanaan program Makan Bergizi Gratis (MBG). Dadan pun mengajak pemerintah daerah untuk ikut memfasilitasi SPPG memperoleh SLHS. (Fx. Suryo Wicaksono/Chairul Fajri/Gracia Simanjuntak)

title: Iran nyatakan perjanjian nuklir Kairo tak lagi jadi dasar kerja sama
description: ANTARA - Iran menyatakan hubungan kerja samanya dengan Badan Energi Atom Internasional (IAEA) berada di titik baru. Menurut Menlu Seyed Abbas Araghchi, penerapan mekanisme snapback dan perubahan kondisi politik membuat perjanjian Kairo tidak lagi relevan untuk diterapkan. (XINHUA/I Gusti Agung Ayu N/Agha Yuninda Maulana/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Korsleting picu kebakaran ICU, enam pasien tewas di rumah sakit India
description: ANTARA - Enam pasien dilaporkan tewas dalam kebakaran yang melanda ruang ICU di Rumah Sakit Sawai Man Singh, Jaipur, India barat. Polisi menyebut kebakaran terjadi akibat korsleting listrik yang membuat api cepat menyebar di lantai dua rumah sakit tersebut.(XINHUA/I Gusti Agung Ayu N/Agha Yuninda Maulana/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Kampung Cempluk Festival 2025 angkat budaya dan UMKM lokal
description: ANTARA - Kampung Cempluk Festival kembali digelar di Dusun Sumberjo, Desa Kalisongo, Kabupaten Malang, pada 6-11 Oktober. Festival yang sudah berlangsung sebanyak 15 kali itu berhasil menyedot pengunjung yang ingin merasakan kampung tempo dulu, serta menjajal jajanan tradisional dari seratusan UMKM yang dilibatkan. (Achmad Saif Hajarani/Chairul Fajri/Gracia Simanjuntak)

title: MGPA: Kesuksesan MotoGP Mandalika berkat kolaborasi semua pihak
description: ANTARA - Penyelenggaraan Pertamina Grand Prix of Indonesia 2025 di Sirkuit Mandalika, Lombok, Nusa Tenggara Barat pada 3-5 Oktober merupakan keberhasilan kolaborasi nasional. Direktur Utama Mandalika Grand Prix Assosiation Priandhi Satria menyampaikan apresiasi bagi semua pihak yang berperan, menegaskan profesionalisme yang membanggakan bangsa di kancah dunia. (Kusnandar/Andi Bagasela/Gracia Simanjuntak)

title: Identifikasi korban Ponpes Al Khoziny libatkan para ahli
description: ANTARA - Tim "Disaster Victim Investigation" Kepolisian Daerah Jawa Timur (DVI Polda Jatim) melibatkan para ahli untuk mengidentifikasi jenazah para korban ambruknya bangunan Pondok Pesantren (Ponpes) Al Khoziny Sidoarjo, melalui rekonsiliasi yang digelar di Surabaya, Senin (6/10). Rekonsiliasi tersebut membahas pencocokan data antemortem dan postmortem seluruh jenazah korban yang diterima di Pos Komando (Posko) DVI Rumah Sakit Bhayangkara Polea Jatim Surabaya. (Hanif Nasrullah/Andi Bagasela/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Menkum terbitkan SK baru akhiri dualisme kepemimpinan PPP
description: ANTARA - Menteri Hukum Supratman Andi Agtas menerbitkan surat keputusan (SK) terkait susunan kepengurusan baru Partai Persatuan Pembangunan (PPP), yang mengakhiri konflik dualisme kepemimpinan dalam partai tersebut. Dalam konferensi pers di Jakarta, Senin (6/10), Menkum menjelaskan berdasarkan SK tersebut, Muhammad Mardiono tetap sebagai Ketua Umum PPP periode 2025-2030, sedangkan Agus Suparmanto sebagai Wakil Ketua Umum. (Suci Nurhaliza/Pradanna Putra Tampi/Chairul Fajri/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Freeport Indonesia temukan tujuh korban luncuran material basah
description: ANTARA - Tim Penyelamat PT Freeport Indonesia bekerja sama dengan Kementerian ESDM, Polres Mimika, Basarnas, dan B-P-B-D telah menemukan total 7 korban di insiden luncuran material basah di Tambang Bawah Tanah Grasberg Block Cave. Pada Minggu (5/10), dalam tahap penyelamatan akhir, Tim PT Freeport kembali menemukan 5 korban, setelah 2 korban sebelumnya ditemukan pada Sabtu (20/9) lalu. (Sanya Dinda Susanti/Andi Bagasela/Roy Rosa Bachtiar)

title: Menkum bantah TNI jadi penyidik dalam RUU Keamanan dan Ketahanan Siber
description: ANTARA - Menteri Hukum Supratman Andi Agtas membantah isu yang menyebut RUU Keamanan dan Ketahanan Siber akan memberikan kewenangan kepada TNI untuk menjadi penyidik. Di Jakarta, Senin (6/10), Menkum mengatakan RUU tersebut tidak akan menyebut secara spesifik siapa yang berwenang sebagai penyidik, sebab telah diatur melalui undang-undang lainnya. (Suci Nurhaliza/Pradanna Putra Tampi/Chairul Fajri/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Adik Jusuf Kalla jadi tersangka dugaan korupsi PLTU 1 Kalbar
description:
ANTARA - Korps Pemberantasan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Kortastipidkor) Polri menetapkan 4 tersangka dalam kasus dugaan korupsi PLTU 1 Kalimantan Barat. Dalam konferensi pers di Jakarta, Senin (6/10), Kakortastipidkor Polri Irjen Pol Cahyono Wibowo mengungkap salah satu tersangka yakni adik Wakil Presiden RI ke-10 dan 12 Jusuf Kalla, Halim Kalla.
(Suci Nurhaliza/Pradanna Putra Tampi/Chairul Fajri/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Kemenkum wajibkan Perseroan Terbatas RUPS dan buat laporan keuangan
description:
ANTARA - Kementerian Hukum mulai mewajibkan seluruh perseroan terbatas (PT) untuk melakukan Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham (RUPS) minimal setahun sekali, dan membuat laporan keuangan. Dirjen Administrasi Hukum Umum (AHU) Kemenkum Widodo di Jakarta, Senin (6/10), mengatakan setelah Beneficial Ownership (BO) atau pemilik manfaat suatu aset atau perusahaan diverifikasi, termasuk para pemilik PT, wajib melakukan RUPS minimal setahun sekali.
(Sanya Dinda Susanti/Chairul Fajri/Gracia Simanjuntak)

title: Gubernur Kalteng fasilitasi kebutuhan di rutan Palangka Raya
description:
ANTARA - Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah, Agustiar Sabran, melakukan peninjauan ke Rumah Tahanan Negara Kelas II A Palangka Raya, Senin (06/10). Kunjungan ini bertujuan melihat langsung aktivitas warga binaan sekaligus menjalin kerja sama di bidang layanan kesehatan, ketenagakerjaan, dan usaha kecil menengah untuk meningkatkan kreativitas mereka di dalam rutan.
(Redianto Tumon Sp/Chairul Fajri/I Gusti Agung Ayu N)

title: Peserta terbaik MTQ ke-24 Kota Cilegon terima kadedeuh hingga umrah
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah Kota Cilegon, Senin (6/10), memberikan kadedeuh atau uang tali asih kepada 177 peserta terbaik lomba MTQ ke-24 Tingkat Kota Cilegon, serta tiket umrah kepada tiga orang peserta yang akan dikirim untuk mewakili Provinsi Banten pada tingkat STQH Nasional XXVIII di Kendari, Sulawesi Tenggara, pada 9-19 Oktober mendatang. Wali Kota Cilegon, Robinsar, menyatakan uang kadedeuh ini adalah bentuk dukungan pemerintah kepada peserta untuk terus bersemangat mengasah kemampuan sebagai qori dan qoriah terbaik Kota Cilegon. (Susmiatun Hayati/Andi Bagasela/Rijalul Vikry)

title: Ratusan atlet muda Jatim ramaikan festival bulutangkis U-15
description:
ANTARA - Festival bulutangkis U-15 Piala Menpora seri Regional 8 Jawa Timur bergulir di Malang Badminton Arena sejak 4-8 Oktober 2025. Gelaran ini digelar sebagai upaya dalam memberi ruang bagi bibit-bibit muda bulutangkis di Jawa Timur agar bisa tampil, berkompetisi dan mengasah kemampuan.
(Achmad Saif Hajarani/Yovita Amalia/I Gusti Agung Ayu N)

title: Kaltim cegah penyebaran TBC dengan Tes Cepat Molekuler
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah Provinsi Kalimantan Timur berupaya mencegah penyebaran penyakit Tuberkulosis (TBC) melalui  Tes Cepat Molekuler (TCM). Layanan tes yang dihadirkan di sejumlah fasilitas kesehatan tersebut digunakan untuk mendeteksi bakteri penyebab TBC agar dapat segera ditangani.(Hanifan Ma'ruf/Andi Bagasela/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Pemerintah sita aset tambang ilegal di Babel senilai Rp7 triliun
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah telah menyita aset dari tambang ilegal di kawasan konsesi PT Timah Tbk, Bangka Belitung, mulai dari smelter, ratusan ribu kilogram timah, hingga alat berat. Presiden Prabowo Subianto, Senin (6/10), menyebut sitaan tersebut memiliki nilai Rp7 triliun rupiah. (Cahya Sari/Yovita Amalia/Roy Rosa Bachtiar)

title: Prabowo serahkan 6 smelter sitaan kasus korupsi ke PT Timah
description: ANTARA - Presiden Prabowo Subianto, Senin (6/10), menyaksikan penyerahan enam smelter kepada PT Timah Tbk yang merupakan hasil sitaan dari tambang ilegal. Usai meninjau langsung sejumlah barang sitaan di smelter PT Tinindo Internusa, di Kota Pangkalpinang, Bangka Belitung, Prabowo mengatakan kerugian negara dari enam smelter yang beroperasi tanpa izin tersebut diperkirakan mencapai Rp300 triliun. (Cahya Sari/Andi Bagasela/Rijalul Vikry)

title: BRIN: Dentuman di Cirebon berasal dari meteor, bukan ledakan
description: ANTARA - Peneliti Ahli Utama Pusat Riset Antariksa, Badan Riset dan Inovasi Nasional (BRIN), Prof. Thomas Djamaluddin, Senin (6/9), memastikan bahwa dentuman yang terdengar di wilayah Kabupaten Kuningan hingga Kabupaten Cirebon, Minggu malam (5/10), disebabkan oleh meteor berukuran cukup besar yang melintas di langit Jawa Barat. Diperkirakan ukuran meteor Cirebon sekitar 3 hingga 5 meter dan jatuh ke laut serta tidak berkaitan dengan kejadian kebakaran di Brebes. (Dian Hardiana/Yovita Amalia/Rijalul Vikry)

title: SPPG Cinere gandeng Puskesmas untuk pastikan kesehatan  pegawai
description: ANTARA - Satuan Pelayanan Pemenuhan Gizi (SPPG) Cinere Depok Jawa Barat menggandeng Puskesmas Cinere untuk mengawasi kesehatan fisik dan mental pegawai SPPG. Ditemui awak media di Depok, Jawa Barat, Senin (6/10) Tim Pengawas Puskesmas Cinere Putri Agustin menjelaskan pengawasan tersebut salah satunya dengan melakukan pemeriksaan kesehatan atau medical check up selama satu bulan sekali. (Irfansyah Naufal Nasution/Yovita Amalia/Nanien Yuniar)

title: BNPB targetkan evakuasi korban ponpes roboh rampung Senin 6 Oktober
description: ANTARA - Tim gabungan melanjutkan proses pencarian korban di lokasi runtuhnya musala Pondok Pesantren Al-Khoziny Sidoarjo, Jawa Timur yang menelan puluhan korban jiwa pada Senin (6/10). BNPB menargetkan proses evakuasi seluruh korban dapat diselesaikan pada hari ini. (Putri Hanifa/Andi Bagasela/Roy Rosa Bachtiar)

title: PT Timah siap kelola enam smelter sitaan kasus korupsi di Babel
description: ANTARA - PT. Timah Tbk menyatakan kesiapannya mengelola smelter sitaan kasus korupsi tata niaga komoditas timah di Provinsi Kepulauan Bangka Belitung. Kesiapan tersebut ditandai dengan penyerahan aset barang rampasan negara berupa enam smelter milik PT. Tinindo Internusa kepada PT. Timah Tbk, yang disaksikan langsung oleh Presiden RI Prabowo Subianto, di Kota Pangkalpinang, Senin (6/9). (Chandrika Purnama Dewi/Andi Bagasela/Rijalul Vikry)

title: Pemko Lhokseumawe siapkan sarana dan SDM untuk eksploitasi migas
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah Kota Lhokseumawe, Aceh, menyiapkan sumber daya manusia dan perusahaan lokal untuk dapat berpartisipasi dalam eksploitasi minyak dan gas yang terdapat di perairan Lhokseumawe. Hal tersebut disampaikan Wali Kota Lhokseumawe, Sayuti Abubakar saat audiensi dengan 72 pelaku usaha lokal yang berkecimpung dalam bisnis minyak dan gas, Senin (6/10). (Try Vanny S/Andi Bagasela/Rijalul Vikry)

title: Indonesia ajukan tambahan kuota tuna sirip biru selatan di forum CCSBT
description: ANTARA - Menteri Kelautan dan Perikanan Wahyu Sakti Trenggono mengajukan penambahan kuota tuna sirip biru selatan (southern bluefin tuna) bagi Indonesia hingga 15 persen. Pengajuan tersebut disampaikannya dalam pertemuan tahunan ke-32 Komisi Konservasi Tuna Sirip Biru Selatan (Commision For The Conservation of Southern Bluefin Tuna/ CCSBT) di Nusa Dua, Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Senin (6/10). (Rita Laura/Yovita Amalia/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Sekolah rakyat jenjang SD di Solo resmi beroperasi, tampung 50 siswa
description: ANTARA - Sebanyak 50 siswa yang terbagi ke dalam dua rombongan belajar mulai mengikuti Sekolah Rakyat Dasar 2 Solo yang bertempat di Balai Pelatihan Vokasi dan Produktivitas (BPVP) Solo, Jawa Tengah. Wakil Menteri Sosial Agus Jabo Priyono menghadiri langsung pembukaan masa pengenalan lingkungan sekolah (MPLS) di Sekolah Rakyat Dasar 2 Solo pada Senin (6/10). (Denik Apriyani/Yovita Amalia/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Polda Aceh amankan satu ton lebih narkoba dalam tiga bulan terakhir
description: ANTARA - Polda Aceh gagalkan upaya penyeludupan narkotika jenis sabu seberat 80,5 kilogram dan 1 kilogram kokain, dalam rentan waktu tiga bulan terakhir. Selain itu, Polda Aceh juga mengamankan 1,3 ton ganja kering. Dalam pengungkapan tersebut polisi ikut menangkap 22 tersangka. (Aprizal Rachmad/Yovita Amalia/Roy Rosa Bachtiar)

title: Badan Bahasa dan DPR perkuat upaya literasi nasional
description:
ANTARA - Pemerintah melalui Badan Pengembangan dan Pembinaan Bahasa (Badan Bahasa) terus berupaya meningkatkan budaya literasi nasional, meski dihadapkan pada berbagai tantangan, terutama keterbatasan anggaran. Upaya ini dilakukan melalui kerja sama dengan Komisi X DPR RI untuk memperluas akses buku bacaan bermutu dan menumbuhkan minat baca anak-anak di seluruh Indonesia.
(Dian Hardiana/Andi Bagasela/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Upaya Kementerian Hukum tutup celah kejahatan keuangan
description: ANTARA - Kementerian Hukum bekerja sama dengan kementerian dan lembaga lain untuk melakukan verifikasi terhadap beneficial owner (BO) atau pemilik manfaat suatu aset atau perusahaan, guna menutup celah kejahatan keuangan. Penandatanganan perjanjian kerja sama itu dilakukan oleh Dirjen Administrasi Hukum Umum Kemenkum Widodo bersama perwakilan Kementerian ESDM, KPPU, Kemendagri dan Kadin, di kantor Kemenkum Jakarta, Senin (6/10). (Sanya Dinda Susanti/Yovita Amalia/Nanien Yuniar)

title: Kenaikan harga emas dorong inflasi pada September 2025
description: ANTARA - Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) mencatat kenaikan harga emas perhiasan menjadi faktor utama pendorong inflasi pada September 2025. Kepala BPS Amalia Adininggar Widyasanti di Jakarta, Senin (6/10), mengatakan kondisi ini turut mengerek inflasi tahunan ke level 2,65 persen dan inflasi tahun ini berjalan sebesar 1,82 persen. (Putri Hanifa/Andi Bagasela/Roy Rosa Bachtiar)

title: Kemendagri minta daerah bergerak cepat kendalikan inflasi
description:
ANTARA - Sekjen Kemendagri Tomsi Tohir dalam Rapat Pengendalian Inflasi Daerah di Jakarta, Senin (6/10), menilai kenaikan inflasi di sejumlah provinsi perlu mendapat perhatian serius dari pemerintah daerah. Ia menyebut inflasi di Sumatera Utara tercatat paling tinggi mencapai 5,32 persen disusul Riau, Aceh, dan Sumatera Barat.
(Putri Hanifa/Yovita Amalia/I Gusti Agung Ayu N)

title: Pasar Kota Wonogiri terbakar, Bupati siapkan pasar darurat
description: ANTARA - Kebakaran terjadi di Pasar Kota Wonogiri, Jawa Tengah, pada Senin (6/10), mengakibatkan ratusan kios dan los pedagang hangus dilalap api selama kurang lebih enam jam. Bupati Wonogiri, Setyo Sukarno menyatakan pihaknya memberikan solusi untuk para pedagang dengan menyiapkan pasar darurat. (Denik Apriyani/Andi Bagasela/Rijalul Vikry)

title: Bulog siapkan 28 ribu ton beras subsidi untuk stabilisasi harga
description: ANTARA - Perum Badan Urusan Logistik (Bulog) Kantor Wilayah Kalimantan Barat  menyiapkan lebih dari 28 ribu ton beras medium bersubsidi untuk mendukung program Stabilisasi Pasokan dan Harga Pangan (SPHP) di wilayah setempat, Senin (6/10). Program prioritas yang dilaksanakan hingga akhir Desember 2025 itu menjadi wujud komitmen pemerintah dalam menjaga ketersediaan dan mencegah terjadinya fluktuasi harga di sektor pangan.(Indra Budi Santoso/Andi Bagasela/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Perindah tampilan tata kota, Cilegon perbaiki sejumlah halte rusak
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah Kota Cilegon memperbaiki halte-halte yang kondisinya rusak agar lebih nyaman dan estetik, untuk memperindah tampilan tata kota dan mengembalikan fungsi halte. Kepala Dinas Perhubungan Kota Cilegon, Heri Suheri pada Senin (6/10), mengatakan dari total delapan halte yang dimiliki Pemkot Cilegon saat ini sudah ada sebanyak tiga halte yang diperbaiki.(Susmiatun Hayati/Yovita Amalia/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Tidak terapkan SOP, satu dapur MBG di Temanggung dihentikan sementara
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah pusat menghentikan sementara satu Satuan Pelayanan Pemenuhan Gizi (SPPG) pengelola dapur program makan bergizi gratis (MBG) di Temanggung, Jawa Tengah, Senin (6/10). Penghentian itu karena pihak SPPG tidak menjalankan standar operasional prosedur (SOP) yang menyebabkan insiden keracunan.(Firman Eko Handy/Yovita Amalia/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Pemkot Ambon sediakan layanan internet gratis di 40 titik
description: ANTARA - Pemerintah kota (Pemkot) Ambon menyediakan layanan internet jaringan nirkabel (WIFI) gratis pada 40 titik di berbagai ruang publik yang adai di kota Ambon, Maluku. Layanan internet tersebut dihadirkan agar masyarakat dapat menikmati akses internet secara gratis. (Alfian Sanusi/Rizky Bagus Dhermawan/Ludmila Yusufin Diah Nastiti)

title: Badenoch defends Jenrick’s ‘no white faces in Birmingham’ comments
description:
Tory leader says ‘nothing wrong with making observations’ after Jenrick said Handsworth was ‘one of worst integrated places I’ve ever been to’

  • UK politics live – latest updates

Kemi Badenoch has defended her colleague Robert Jenrick over his complaint about not seeing “another white face” in part of Birmingham but said the debate should not be about what people look like in the streets.

The Conservative leader said the shadow justice secretary had made a “factual statement” and there was “nothing wrong with making observations”. But she also told BBC Breakfast: “I don’t think this is where the debate should be about how many faces people see on the street and what they look like.”

Édouard Philippe, a former French prime minister and one-time ally of Emmanuel Macron, has said he favours early presidential elections given the gravity of the political crisis rocking the country.

title: Gaza ceasefire talks live: negotiations to continue as Israelis mark two-year anniversary of 7 October attacks
description:
The first day of Gaza talks between Hamas and mediators on Monday ended in Egypt ‘amid a positive atmosphere’, local media reported

  • Israel and Hamas begin indirect talks as hopes rise of ending Gaza war

Unrwa, the UN agency for Palestinian refugees, has published some figures showing the catastrophic human damage Israel’s war has caused in Gaza (you can read more in the organisation’s factsheet here):

Over 66,100 people reported killed

Nearly all of Gaza’s residents have been displaced

Nearly 80% of structures damaged or destroyed

Over 370 Unrwa workers killed

Less than 40% of hospitals remain functional, all partially

This is a humanitarian catastrophe on a scale that defies comprehension. Put an end to the hostilities in Gaza, Israel & the region now. Stop making civilians pay with their lives & their futures. After two years of trauma, we must choose hope. Now.

Continue reading...

title: Ineos to cut a fifth of Hull jobs, blaming ‘dirt-cheap’ imports from China
description:
Company says more roles will be at risk unless UK government supports tariffs to protect industry

  • Business live – latest updates

Ineos, the chemicals company owned by the billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe, is to cut a fifth of jobs at its East Yorkshire plant, blaming “sky high” energy costs and “dirt-cheap” imports from China.

The company said it would cut 60 jobs at the Ineos Acetyls site in Hull, which makes petrochemical products such as acetic acid, and said more roles would be at risk across the industry unless the government stepped in.

title: UK house price growth slows as buyers show caution before budget
description:
Cost of a typical home fell £794 to £298,184 in September after 0.2% monthly rise in August, says Halifax

  • Business live – latest updates

UK house prices rose by a slower-than-expected 1.3% in the year to September, according to Halifax, the weakest annual figure since April 2024.

The reading confounded a Reuters poll of economists that forecast it would pick up to 2.2% from August’s 2% rate, suggesting caution in the market in the run-up to the autumn budget.

  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

The Palestine Action Group has asked a Sydney court to find that Israel is carrying out a genocide in Gaza, as activists push to hold a protected protest at the city’s Opera House.

A representative of the group and another from Jews Against Occupation were taking on New South Wales police in the state’s supreme court after the force opposed a proposed march from Hyde Park to the Sydney Opera House on 12 October.

Grief and confusion gripped East Java last week after foundational failures caused the Al Khoziny Islamic school to collapse during afternoon prayers

Indonesian rescuers wrapped up the search on Tuesday for victims trapped under the rubble of a collapsed Islamic boarding school in the province of East Java, after retrieving more than 60 bodies, disaster authorities said.

Grief and confusion gripped the small town of Sidoarjo last week after foundational failures caused the Al Khoziny school to cave in on hundreds of people, mostly teenage boys, while they were at afternoon prayers. Most escaped.

title: Polda Aceh Musnahkan Satu Ton Lebih Narkoba Berbagai Jenis
description: Kepolisian Daerah (Polda) Aceh memusnahkan barang bukti narkotika hasil pengungkapan selama tiga bulan terakhir. Total barang bukti yang dimusnahkan mencapai 80,5 kilogram sabu, 1,3 ton ganja, dan 1 kilogram kokain. Barang bukti itu merupakan hasil pengungkapan kasus di berbagai wilayah Aceh. Polda Aceh juga menahan 22 orang tersangka terkait kasus peredaran barang haram ini. Kapolda Aceh, Irjen Pol Marzuki Ali Basyah, mengatakan pengungkapan narkotika ini dari tiga wilayah berbeda, yakni Gayo Lues, Aceh Utara, dan Kota Sabang. Pemusnahan narkotika jenis sabu dan kokain dilakukan dengan melarutkan barang haram tersebut dengan cairan kimia. Sedangkan untuk ganja, pemusnahan dilakukan dengan cara dibakar di area belakang markas Polda Aceh.

title: ‘It’s a big question’: kibbutz residents ponder return home after Hamas attack
description:
Two years on, Israel has said the Holit community can go back – but memories of the horrific events are still raw

Shir Matias wants to move back to the Holit kibbutz but doesn’t know if she will be able to bear it. Now 23, she grew up in this tiny community in Israel’s farthest south-west tip, and its flower-lined paths hold some of her happiest memories.

It is also the place where her parents were murdered by Hamas gunmen on 7 October 2023, and her brother Rotem was badly injured. Their mother, Shachar, used her own body to shield him from the bullets, saving his life in a last act of love.

Continue reading...

title: No air traffic control crew at busy LA airport amid government shutdown staffing crunch
description:
Air traffic to the Hollywood Burbank Airport would be remotely managed for six hours on Monday night causing delays for travellers

Hollywood Burbank Airport in Los Angeles will have no air traffic control staff for nearly six hours on Monday evening, as the effects of the US government shutdown rippled across the country.

From 4.15pm until 10pm the Federal Aviation Administration anticipates there will be no air traffic controllers in their tower, although the FAA has said it is trying to bring in staffing sooner than that, according to ABC News.

title: Israelis gather to mark two years since 7 October Hamas attack that killed 1,200
description:
Commemorations held in kibbutzim whose members were killed or kidnapped and Tel Aviv rally will call for hostages’ release

Israelis will gather across the country on Tuesday to mark the second anniversary of the 7 October attack, in which Hamas-led militants killed about 1,200 people and took 251 hostages during an assault on southern Israel.

Unofficial commemorations will be held in the small kibbutzim of southern Israel whose members were killed or kidnapped, and a large rally will be held in Tel Aviv to call for the release of the remaining hostages from Hamas captivity in Gaza.

title: New California law bans loud ads on streaming services for ‘peace and quiet’
description:
Legislation was written by lawmaker whose aide had complained about ad breaks startling his newborn daughter

California ordered its powerful entertainment industry to turn down the volume on Monday, with a new law that requires streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime and YouTube to ensure that audio levels do not suddenly skyrocket during commercial breaks.

The legislation, signed into state law by the governor, Gavin Newsom, forces the powerful streaming platforms to comply with existing regulations that have barred television broadcasters from bombarding the eardrums of viewers with overly loud commercials since 2010.

A court hearing for a man charged over an alleged shooting spree in Sydney’s inner west on Sunday night has been delayed by a dispute over which of two lawyers was representing him.

title: Trump orders approval of 211-mile mining road through Alaska wilderness
description:
Ambler Road project, approved in Trump’s first term but blocked by Biden, would harm Native tribes and wildlife

Donald Trump on Monday ordered the approval of a proposed 211-mile road through an Alaska wilderness to allow mining of copper, cobalt, gold and other minerals.

The long-debated Ambler Road project was approved in the US president’s first term, but was later blocked by the Biden administration after an analysis determined the project would threaten caribou and other wildlife and harm Alaska Indigenous tribes that rely on hunting and fishing.

title: Republicans post fake image of Oregon protest – using photos of South America
description:

Before a federal judge blocked Donald Trump from putting members of California’s national guard on the streets of Portland, Oregon, late on Sunday, the state’s Republican party welcomed the planned deployment in celebratory posts on social media.

“President Trump on Sunday deployed 300 California National Guard troops to Portland, Oregon after a judge ruled that the Oregon National Guard could not be deployed to keep federal facilities and personnel in Portland safe,” Oregon Republicans wrote on their official Facebook, Instagram and X accounts.

Iran signalled its support for Trump’s Gaza plan, with the country’s foreign ministry saying it supports any initiative that brings an end to the genocide of Palestinian people.

Iran’s foreign ministry wrote in a post on X:

Taking into account the dangerous dimensions and aspects of this proposal, and while reiterating its warning about the repeated breaches and obstructionism by the Zionist regime in fulfilling its promises, especially in light of its expansionist and racist plans, the Islamic Republic of Iran considers any decision in this regard to be within the authority of the Palestinian people and resistance.

It welcomes any decision by them that guarantees halting the genocide of Palestinians, the withdrawal of the occupying Zionist army from Gaza, respect for the Palestinian people’s right to self-determination, the entry of humanitarian aid, and the reconstruction of Gaza.

title: Judge killed in courtroom shooting in Albania
description:
Man opens fire in Tirana court, killing judge and injuring two other people, and is arrested after fleeing scene

A man on trial opened fire in a courtroom in the Albanian capital, Tirana, killing the judge and injuring two other people, police have said.

The judge, Astrit Kalaja, was presiding during a hearing at the court of appeal on Monday when the man opened fire, police said, adding that the shooter was promptly arrested. “The judge was rushed to the hospital, but succumbed to his injuries on the way,” a police statement said.

title: Israel and Hamas begin indirect talks as hopes rise of ending Gaza war
description:
Hamas’s acceptance of key conditions of deal galvanises momentum but large gaps remain between camps

Israel and Hamas have begun indirect talks in Egypt on a US ceasefire proposal amid cautious optimism that the nearly two-year war in Gaza may be nearing its end, despite deep divisions between the two sides.

Negotiations will focus on the release of hostages held by Hamas in exchange for Palestinian prisoners in Israeli jails, as well as the partial withdrawal of Israeli troops from Gaza. The three issues constitute the first phase of a 20-point plan presented by the US president, Donald Trump, last week that aims to end the war.

title: Gaza flotilla members allege beatings and insults in Israeli detention
description:
Some of those held say guns were pointed at them, they were threatened with dogs and deprived of sleep

International activists, journalists and lawyers deported from Israel after attempting to breach the 16-year maritime blockade of Gaza as part of a humanitarian flotilla have alleged being subjected to brutal physical and verbal abuse by Israeli forces during their detention.

The alleged abuses included sleep and medication deprivation, beatings, having automatic rifles pointed at their heads, dogs set upon them, having to sleep on the floor, being subjected to insults and being made to watch footage of the Hamas attacks on Israel on 7 October 2023.

Presidents spoke on a video call as expert speculates that Haiti could be an area where the two leaders can cooperate

Brazil’s president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, has urged Donald Trump to scrap tariffs on his country’s imports and sanctions against its officials, as the two men held what the Brazilian presidency called a “friendly” video call, swapping phone numbers after months of friction.

Ties between the US and Brazil have nosedived as a result of Trump’s campaign to pressure Brazilian authorities into abandoning the coup trial of his far-right ally, Jair Bolsonaro.

title: ICC convicts former Sudan militia leader for war crimes in Darfur
description:
Janjaweed commander Ali Muhammad Ali Abd-al-Rahman, known as Ali Kushayb, found guilty over atrocities

The international criminal court has convicted a leader of the Janjaweed militia of playing a leading role in a campaign of atrocities committed in the Sudanese region of Darfur more than 20 years ago.

It was the first time the court had convicted a suspect of crimes in Darfur. The court ruled that the atrocities, including mass murders and rapes, were part of a government plan to snuff out a rebellion in the western region of Sudan.

title: Eswatini confirms arrival of 10 more people as part of US deportation deal
description:
African kingdom receives second group of third-country nationals in what NGOs and lawyers say is violation of human rights

Ten people deported by the US have arrived in Eswatini, its government said, the second group of third-country deportees to be sent to the southern African kingdom by the Trump administration in what lawyers and NGOs have described as violations of their human rights.

A statement by the Eswatini government posted on social media before their arrival on Monday said: “The individuals will be kept in a secured area separate from the public, while arrangements are made for their return to their countries of origin.”

title: Festival Pertengahan Musim Gugur di Anhui
description:
People dance with a straw-woven dragon at Shuyuan Village, Huizhou District of Huangshan City, east China's Anhui Province, Oct. 4, 2025. As China's Mid-Autumn Festival approaches, villagers at Shuyuan Village highlights their celebration with the straw-woven dragon performance.
  Shuyuan's straw-woven dragon has been listed as a municipal-level intangible cultural heritage that boasts a history spanning over three centuries. Once the date for a dragon performance is slated at the village, locals would spontaneously collect and contribute straws for weaving of the dragon - an omen for a bountiful harvest.
  The straw-woven dragon performance on the occasion of the Mid-Autumn Festival has well blended cultural experience into sightseeing, which serves as a major tourist attraction this year. (Photo by Fan Chengzhu/Xinhua)

title: Hari kelima penghentian operasional pemerintah AS
description:
The U.S. Capitol building is seen in Washington, D.C., the United States, Oct. 5, 2025. As the U.S. federal government entered a shutdown -- the first time in nearly seven years -- the confrontation between President Donald Trump's administration and the Democratic Party has further escalated.
   The Trump administration has cut funding and programs in Democratic-led states and sought to dismantle federal agencies led by Democrats. Meanwhile, Democrats have shown a rare sense of unity, hoping to reverse declining approval ratings through the fight.
   This new round of partisan conflict over the government shutdown is markedly different from previous ones, characterized by greater hostility and malice that has pushed partisan strife to new heights. It highlights the deepening political polarization in the United States while inflicting greater harm on the American people. (Xinhua/Li Rui)

title: Mount Everest hikers describe ‘extreme’ conditions as huge rescue effort continues
description:
At least 200 people still stranded after unseasonally heavy snowfall during China’s Golden Week holiday

Trekkers have described facing “extreme” conditions after an unseasonable snowstorm during one of China’s busiest holiday weekends stranded hundreds of people on Mount Everest, prompting a massive rescue effort.

Chinese authorities said about 350 people had made their way down but at least 200 remained stranded at the Everest Scenic Area, to the east of the mountain, on the Tibetan side of the border.

title: Weather tracker: Typhoon Matmo batters southern China
description:
About 350,000 flee homes as heavy rain and winds sweep region, while Hurricane Priscilla forms near Mexico

Typhoon Matmo made landfall on the southern coast of China on Sunday afternoon, shortly after sweeping across the island province of Hainan. The powerful storm forced the evacuation of about 350,000 people, bringing torrential rain and damaging winds, especially between Wuchuan in Guangdong and Wenchang in Hainan. Ferry services were suspended and flights cancelled at Haikou Meilan airport.

Matmo, the 21st typhoon of the year, had sustained wind speeds of 94mph (151km/h) and dumped more than 50mm of rainfall in six hours in Chongzou and Qinzhou. The city of Nanning also had high rainfall totals.

Continue reading...

title: Gaza flotilla passengers allege poor conditions in detention as Israel prepares to deport dozens of activists
description:
Families of some aboard the Global Sumud Flotilla say they are being held without access to clean water or legal representation

Activists from New Zealand detained in Israel after they were removed from vessels carrying aid to Gaza are being held in poor conditions without access to water and legal representation, their families have said, as dozens more passengers from the Global Sumud Flotilla were set to be deported.

Rana Hamida, Youssef Sammour and Samuel Leason were among 437 activists, parliamentarians and lawyers travelling aboard the flotilla, a coalition of more than 40 vessels carrying humanitarian aid whose goal was to breach Israel’s 16-year maritime blockade of Gaza.

Continue reading...

title: Indonesia school collapse death toll reaches 54 as search for missing students continues
description:
Excavators used to remove rubble while 14 people reportedly still unaccounted for and police allege building work was being carried out without a permit

Indonesian rescuers searching for missing students after a prayer hall at an Islamic boarding school collapsed last week recovered the bodies of dozens of students over the weekend, bringing the confirmed death toll to 54.

Using heavy excavators equipped with jackhammers, circular saws and sometimes their bare hands, rescue teams removed tons of rubble in an attempt to find the 14 students reportedly still missing. Rescuers found 35 bodies over the weekend alone, the National Disaster Mitigation Agency said.

title: US struck another alleged drug boat off Venezuela coast, Trump says
description:
President said US would turn attention to drug trafficking happening on land during speech at navy ceremony

US forces on Saturday evening struck another vessel off the coast of Venezuela, Donald Trump said on Sunday to thousands of sailors at a ceremony celebrating the US navy’s 250th anniversary. He claimed that the vessel had been illegally carrying drugs and added that the US would also start looking at drug trafficking happening on land.

Trump made the comment during a speech at Naval Station Norfolk in Virginia, next to the Harry S Truman aircraft carrier. It was not immediately clear if he was referencing a strike announced on Friday by the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth.

With Islamist militant group 40km from Mogadishu, a ‘strategic stalemate’ has been reached, but some fear worst is yet to come

One night in early July, Maryan Abdikadir Geedi decided it was finally time to abandon her small shop in the town of Moqokori in the Hiiraan region of Somalia.

Though she had heard of the rapid recent gains made by al-Shabaab, the Islamist militant movement, the 46-year-old had hoped to stay. Since getting married in 2013, Geedi had seen control over Moqokori change hands repeatedly.

title: Hegseth says four killed in US strike on alleged drug boat off Venezuelan coast
description:
Pentagon chief says strike – fourth by US military in recent weeks – targeted boat with ‘substantial amounts’ of drugs

The United States carried out a strike against an alleged drug-trafficking boat on Friday that killed four people, US defense secretary Pete Hegseth said, a day after the Trump administration told Congress it was entering a new “non-international armed conflict” with cartels.

The strike, which Hegseth said he directed on Donald Trump’s orders, appears to be at least the fourth in recent weeks. Hegseth gave few details about the boat or the evidence that it was carrying narcotics, other than saying the US had confirmed it was carrying drugs.

title: BTC ALMOST $120K, CRYPTO IS GREEN, PNKSTR JUMPS 50% TO $140M
description: Crypto majors see more green; Bitcoin at $118,800. ZCash continues to lead, soaring 50% to $140. US government shutdown pauses ETF approvals. Lighter leaves private beta, opens Perps platform to public. Polymarket eyes US return as soon as today. PNKSTR jumps 50% to $140M as other NFT Strategies boom. Crypto majors are green again continuing the shutdown rally; BTC +2% at $118,800, ETH +2% at $4,380, XRP +1% at $2.99, SOL +4% at $225. ZEC (+50%), DEXE (+30%) and SPX (+17%) led top movers. Zcash rocketed ~63% to a three-year high, as traders (and Naval) pitch privacy coin as “insurance” hedge during Bitcoin strength. BTC ETFs saw another $675.8M in net inflows, now over $1.6B on the week so far. MSTR stock jumped 5% yesterday after Strategy avoided a multi-billion AMT (tax) hit after new IRS/Treasury guidance, easing concerns over taxes on unrealized gains tied to its Bitcoin holdings. Polymarket is poised to relaunch for U.S. users within days, as filings show self-certified contracts after acquiring a CFTC-licensed venue. Circle introduced a new tokenized US Treasury fund USYC on Solana. The UK government seeks to keep most of $7B in Bitcoin it just seized linked to massive Chinese fraud. The White House withdrew Brian Quintenz for CFTC chair, reopening leadership questions at the derivatives regulator amid active crypto agenda. New York is running a pilot to give low income residents $12,000 in USDC to help alleviate poverty, with funding provided by Coinbase. VisionSys AI is partnering with Marinade Finance to launch a SOL TreasuryCo, aiming to acquire $500M in SOL over the next 6 months (and stake it) with larger goals to accumulate up to $2B. The US government shut down has halted the ETF approval process, diminishing hopes of any early October approvals (i.e. for SOL.

Two Kenyan activists have been abducted in Uganda after attending a presidential campaign event for Bobi Wine, the reggae musician turned politician.

Heavily armed security operatives detained Bob Njagi, the chair of Free Kenya, and Nicholas Oyoo, the movement’s secretary general, at a petrol station near Kampala on Wednesday afternoon.

title: Arbitrary detention victims urge Starmer to press Modi on jailed British Sikh
description:
Activist Jagtar Singh Johal has been held in Indian prison for nearly eight years without full trial

The sisters of the British-Egyptian human rights campaigner Alaa Abd el-Fattah have intervened for the first time since his release from prison in Egypt to call on Keir Starmer to push Narendra Modi to free a British Sikh activist when he meets the Indian prime minister next week.

Jagtar Singh Johal, from Dumbarton, has been held in an Indian jail for nearly eight years without facing full trial in what his supporters say is an arbitrary and egregious denial of justice by a British ally.

title: Afghanistan ‘blind without phones and internet’ on second day of telecoms blackout
description:
Taliban authorities cut fibre-optic network in nationwide shutdown of communications to prevent ‘vice’

Afghans are living under a near-complete communications blackout after Taliban authorities cut internet and mobile phone services for a second day as part of an unprecedented country-wide crackdown.

The former insurgents, who retook control of Afghanistan in 2021, began gradual restrictions on internet access earlier this month. The measures also affect telephone lines, as they are often routed over the internet.

title: At least 40 dead and 124 injured in crush at Vijay rally in India
description:
Victims include nine children at election campaign gathering in Tamil Nadu led by popular actor and politician

Police in India have opened a criminal case against the leaders of a party headed by the actor turned politician Vijay, after a crowd crush at one of his rallies killed 40 people and injured at least 124 others.

Local officials reported that at least nine children had died at the rally, which took place on Saturday night in the Karur district of Tamil Nadu state in southern India. Vijay, one of the most popular and successful actors in Tamil cinema, who entered politics last year, was addressing the crowd for his Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) party before state elections early next year.

Continue reading...

The Manhattan DA’s Office has stated that it will seek review of the decision in the U.S. Supreme Court.)

title: The Menendez Brothers’ Fight for Freedom
description: The Menendez brothers were given life sentences for gunning down their own parents. Now they’re hoping new evidence could reopen the case. "48 Hours" contributor Natalie Morales reports. | CASE UPDATE:  In May 2025, Lyle and Erik Menendez were resentenced to 50 years to life with the possibility of parole. Due to that resentencing, they are now eligible for parole hearings under youth offender parole laws. In August 2025, the brothers’ first bids for parole were denied. In September 2025, a judge rejected the brothers' habeas petition for a new trial.

title: Last Seen in Breckenridge

title: Trump brags of ‘massive’ oil deal in Pakistan – but drilling has not found any
description:
Announcement of deal baffles experts and former ministers, who say there is no sign of any untapped reserves

The newfound camaraderie between the US and Pakistan was on full display this week as Donald Trump welcomed Pakistan’s prime minister, Shehbaz Sharif, and the country’s powerful army chief, Asim Munir, into the Oval Office, heralding them both as “great leaders”.

Having been cold-shouldered by successive US presidents, this was the first time a Pakistani prime minister had been invited to Washington in more than six years. It was also the unprecedented second time this year that Munir – who holds no official government role – held an intimate meeting with Trump, which many took as a telling signal of where the power to cut deals really lies in Pakistan.

Continue reading...

title: BTC & SOLANA JUMP UP, BNB CROSSES $1,000, HYPE HITS ATH
description: Crypto majors mostly rally post-FOMC; BTC at $117,300. SOL jumps 5% as Forward Industries announces $4B ATM. BNB crosses $1,000 for first time; CZ bull-posts ASTER (+400%). Hype hits new ATH at $59; Project X announces its Phase 2. TokenWorks & PNKSTR announce perpetual machine rollouts for 5 new NFT collections, token soars. Crypto majors are very green after a 25 bps cut at FOMC yesterday; BTC +1% at $117,300, ETH +2% at $4,580, XRP +3% at $3.11, SOL +5% at $247. PENGU (+14%), SPX (+11%) and AVAX (+10%) led top movers. HYPE hit a new ATH at $59 on Wednesday; BNB crossed $1,000 for the first time. The Bitcoin ETFs saw $51M in net outflows, breaking their 7-day inflow streak; the ETH ETFs also saw outflows. Moneygram is embracing stablecoins in partnership with Crossmint, big news for its 50M customers and 200 operating countries. Kraken and Circle are partnering to expand stablecoin access with USDC & EURC integration. NYDFS told banks to adopt blockchain analytics for AML/sanctions controls. A golden statue of Trump holding a Bitcoin has been installed outside the U.S. Capitol building. The SEC approved a generic listing standard which will greatly accelerate the approval process for crypto ETFs.

title: Extended interview: Dr. Sanjay Gupta

He discusses pain, which he calls "the most mysterious of all human sensations," and about the misconceptions about treating it.

title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta on the mysteries of chronic pain
description: Recent research into chronic pain, which afflicts millions of Americans, has led to a surprising source: the brain. "Sunday Morning" host Jane Pauley talks with Dr. Sanjay Gupta (a neurosurgeon and chief medical correspondent for CNN) about his new book, "It Doesn't Have to Hurt," and about the body's defenses against pain. She also talks with heavy metal musician Ed Mowery, whose decades-long experience with complex regional pain syndrome (or CRPS) led to a revolutionary surgery and treatment.

In this documentary, CBS Reports explores the debate over high-tech policing that promises to make our communities safer yet at the same time threatens our civil liberties.

title: Puerto Rico: The exodus after Hurricane Maria
description: Hurricane Maria left Puerto Rico devastated - almost 3,000 people died in its wake, towns were left without power or water for months, and hundreds of thousands of Puerto Ricans left, many never to return. David Begnaud returns to Puerto Rico for CBS Reports to examine the impact of that exodus and what the future holds.

description: Every year, 600 of Kentucky's best high school singers gather at a convention center to practice and perform. But it's what happens back at the hotel that brought Steve Hartman "On the Road" -- a special performance, now in its 38th year.

title: The Uplift: Coco Gauff
description: Tennis superstar Coco Guaff returns to her home court in Delray Beach, Florida, to visit the people who knew her before she was famous – and teach up-and-coming tennis players. Plus, David Begnaud shares the story of two families who met at a grief camp and how it changed their lives.

title: The Uplift: Field of dreams
description: An Iowa farmer turns his field into a tennis stadium that rivals Wimbledon and attracts players from around the country, including a grand slam winner. Plus, more heartwarming stories.

title: The Uplift: Doctor hero
description: A Baltimore doctor who doesn't charge his patients realizes it's those patients who have made him a rich man with their generosity towards him. A man who was a refugee from Central Africa builds a new life in the United States as a police officer, author and father. Plus, more good news.

title: The Uplift: Jimmy Butler
description: NBA star Jimmy Butler has a new side hustle: being a barista. How his side gig selling cups of joe to fellow NBA players turned into a business. Plus, a woman shares how her grandfather's cat inspired her to start a nonprofit that helps animals and pet owners in need.

title: The Uplift: Take me out to the ball game
description: Go behind the scenes of America's famous pastimes. Our reporter tries his hand at selling concessions at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas – home of the Texas Rangers – to see how the ballpark operates. Plus, David Begnaud visits a surprise city with just 48 hours to find a story.

title: The Uplift: Stories that pop
description: A man gets on one knee to pop the question and a photographer snaps the milestone moment. The only problem is she doesn't know the couple and goes to great lengths to find the newly engaged pair. A Texas artist shows off his unique medium: Popcorn. Plus, three heartwarming stories from David Begnaud.

title: The Uplift: The eagles have landed
description: Two beloved bald eagles named Jackie and Shadow received global attention as they awaited the hatching of their eaglets in Big Bear, California. David Begnaud introduces us to a girl who raised funds to obtain a prosthetic limb called the Hero Arm – and in the process, she became a hero to others. Plus, more heartwarming news.

title: The Uplift: An interview with the president
description: An 11-year-old nabbed an interview with President Bill Clinton when he was in sixth grade – but how? Decades later, he shares how his determination landed him in the seat across from the president, which is still inspiring others today. Plus, more heartwarming news.

title: The Uplift: Centenarian friends
description: A 100-year-old and 107-year-old form a friendship as centenarians after meeting at the 80th anniversary of D-Day. Plus, David Begnaud has an update on Roberta Bell, a woman who was fired from her job as a correctional officer because she helped an incarcerated woman by taking care of her baby. Still, she has no regrets for selflessly caring for the boy.

description: Perched in the hills outside Rome sits the Palace of Castel Gandolfo, the centuries-old lakeside summer home for popes, which is also home to the Vatican Observatory, established in 1891 to help bridge the chasm between religion and science. Correspondent Seth Doane talks with scientists and students for whom the Church's observations of the heavens are a means to unite people beyond faith.

title: Eye on America: Fashion's "deadstock" movement and Alaska's snow crab's population bounces back
description: In New York, we see how the fashion industry is making efforts to reduce and reuse discarded fabrics. And in Alaska, we learn how the state's snow crab population has bounced back following a two-year pause on fishing. Watch these stories and more on Eye on America with host Michelle Miller.
source: CBS Eye on America Full Episodes

title: The rise of "Food Babe" in the "MAHA" movement
description: Among the activists in attendance at Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s release of the "Make America Healthy Again" Commission report on Thursday was an influencer known as "the Food Babe." A New York Times piece looks into Vani Hari's shift from Obama ally to Trump supporter. New York Times food culture correspondent Kim Severson joins "America Decides" to unpack her reporting.

title: Elon Musk visits White House, Capitol Hill after saying he's reducing political spending
description: Elon Musk said this week that he is going to be spending less of his money on politics, but he has yet to spend less time in President Trump's orbit. Tina Nguyen, senior reporter for The Verge, joins "America Decides" to discuss.

title: Trump says Harvard has to "change its ways" amid legal battle over international students
description: A federal judge has temporarily halted the Trump administration's attempt to block the enrollment of international students at Harvard University. Sabrina Rodríguez, national political reporter at The Washington Post, and Tyler Kendall, Washington correspondent for Bloomberg, join "America Decides" with analysis.

title: How Trump and his family may profit from his meme coin
description: President Trump gathered with top buyers of his cryptocurrency at his Virginia golf club on Thursday night. His family's use of the meme coin has raised ethical and legal concerns because of how much money it makes the president personally. CBS News political investigative producer Madeleine May has more.

title: Nonpartisan analysis calls Trump budget bill "fiscal failure"
description: The Trump administration is touting the spending cuts in the House-approved budget bill, but a nonpartisan analysis calls the legislation a "fiscal failure." Maya MacGuineas, president of the Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget, joins "America Decides" to discuss.

title: Revisiting polling on Biden's health during his presidency
description: On Sunday, Joe Biden's office announced that the former president had been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer. CBS News executive director of elections and surveys, Anthony Salvanto, joins to look back at Biden-era polling on how Americans felt about the then-president's health.

title: Trump turns Oval Office into minefield for world leaders
description: From South Africa's president this week to Ukraine's Zelenskyy in February, President Trump has turned the Oval Office into a practice room for the "art of the ambush." Is it the new norm that world leaders must navigate when they visit the White House? Ravi Agrawal, editor-in-chief of Foreign Policy magazine, joins "America Decides" to discuss.

title: Trump tells Apple to manufacture iPhones in U.S. or face tariffs
description: President Trump warned Apple on Friday that it could face a 25% tariff if it does not start manufacturing iPhones in the U.S. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes reports.

title: Key features of Trump-backed House GOP budget bill
description: The House delivered President Trump a narrow win on his budget bill Thursday. Lawmakers approved the legislation by a 215-214 vote after a marathon overnight session. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has the details.

title: Suspect in Jewish museum shooting facing several federal charges
description: A man is in custody after two Israeli Embassy staffers were gunned down as they left the Jewish Museum in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday evening. CBS News national security contributor Sam Vinograd and Department of Justice correspondent Scott MacFarlane have the latest on the investigation. Then, CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes joins with reaction from President Trump.

title: "Original Sin" co-author Alex Thompson unpacks alleged "cover-up" of Biden's declining health
description: A new book accuses former President Joe Biden's inner circle of trying to hide his mental and physical decline. Alex Thompson, co-author of "Original Sin," sat down with CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett to discuss his reporting.

title: China eyes international help to resolve U.S. trade war
description: China says trade talks with the U.S. are important amid a 90-day truce that lowered tariffs between the two countries, but other nations need to get involved to reach a full solution. Andrew Polk, partner at Beijing-based research firm Trivium China, joins "America Decides" with analysis.

title: How House GOP passed Trump's budget bill after infighting; Where its path lies in Senate
description: House Republicans passed President Trump's budget bill by a single vote early Thursday morning. Leigh Ann Caldwell, chief Washington correspondent for Puck News, and Juliegrace Brufke, Capitol Hill reporter for 24sight News, join "America Decides" to discuss how the legislation came together after last-minute changes and its chances in the Senate.

title: Trump's crypto dinner raises significant ethical concerns
description: President Trump is holding a private dinner for top buyers of his cryptocurrency "meme coin" at his Washington, D.C., golf club on Thursday night. The move has sparked condemnation from some Democrats. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes reports.

title: Republicans eye New Jersey governorship; Democrats attempt to chart new path forward
description: Democrats and Republicans have wrapped their final primary debates in the New Jersey governor's race. Political strategists Joel Payne and Jeanette Hoffman join "America Decides" with analysis.

title: Target's weak sales report could signal trouble for market, retail industry
description: Stocks tumbled Wednesday amid concerns the new budget bill in Congress could deepen the U.S. deficit. Earlier in the day, Target reported weaker-than-expected earnings due partly to anxiety about the implications of President Trump's tariffs. Javier David, business editor at the Dallas Morning News, joins "America Decides" with analysis.

title: Senate Republicans push to block California's phase out of gas-powered cars
description: Senate Republicans are moving to block California's vehicle standards that would phase out the sale of new gas-powered cars by 2035. Mary Nichols, former chair of the California Air Resources Board, joins "America Decides" to discuss.

title: Why the Justice Department is investigating Andrew Cuomo
description: New York City mayoral frontrunner Andrew Cuomo is facing possible legal trouble. The Justice Department has opened an investigation into the former Empire State governor. CBS News Department of Justice correspondent Scott MacFarlane unpacks what Cuomo is being accused of.

title: Trump administration formally accepts Qatari jet despite concerns
description: The Trump administration has formally accepted the luxury 747 jet offered by the Qatari government as a gift. The Pentagon confirmed the news Wednesday and said it will now work to ensure it meets security requirements for the president's use. CBS News Pentagon reporter Eleanor Watson has the latest.

title: House vote on Trump budget bill could come soon
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson and the Freedom Caucus met with President Trump on Wednesday amid a budget bill impasse. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.

title: What South Africans think of Trump's meeting with Ramaphosa
description: President Trump is being accused of ambushing South Africa's president in the Oval Office Wednesday with claims of "White persecution." BBC News senior journalist Pumza Fihlani is in Johannesburg and has reaction.

title: South African president denies Trump's claims of genocide during tense Oval Office meeting
description: The cordial conversation between President Trump and South Africa's president in the Oval Office on Wednesday quickly turned contentious after Mr. Trump pushed unsubstantiated claims of genocide against White South African farmers. CBS News White House reporter Olivia Rinaldi digs into the claims.

title: Southern California still recovering from January wildfires
description: California is still rebuilding after January's deadly wildfires as officials paint a grim picture of the upcoming fire season. Rick Caruso, real estate developer and former Los Angeles mayoral candidate, joins "America Decides" with an update on where recovery efforts stand.

title: Trump says House Republicans are unified on budget bill
description: Shortly after meeting with Republican House members on Capitol Hill Tuesday, President Trump underscored that his party is unified. However, not all members of the conference support the current budget plan. Republican strategist Mark Bednar joins "America Decides" with more on the president's budget meeting.

title: Jill Biden's former press secretary reacts to "Original Sin" allegations about President Biden
description: The new book "Original Sin" digs into allegations that former President Joe Biden's inner circle fought to hide his mental decline during his time in office. Michael LaRosa, ex-spokesperson for former first lady Jill Biden, and Lauren Tomlinson, Republican strategist, join "America Decides" with their responses to the book.

title: Rep. LaMonica McIver decries Trump DOJ charges as "political intimidation"
description: Democratic Rep. LaMonica McIver of New Jersey says the Trump administration is just trying to intimidate her after she was federally charged with assaulting law enforcement at an ICE facility in Newark. CBS News Department of Justice correspondent Scott MacFarlane reports.

title: New poll shows Andrew Cuomo with big lead in New York City Democratic mayoral primary
description: New York City's mayoral candidates have exactly five weeks until primary day. A recent poll from Marist has former Gov. Andrew Cuomo with a commanding lead over his Democratic competitors. CBS News New York chief political correspondent Marcia Kramer unpacks the state of the race.

title: What we know about Trump's "Golden Dome" missile defense system
description: President Trump says a U.S. missile defense system, similar to Israel's "Iron Dome," will be fully operational by the end of his term. CBS News Pentagon reporter Eleanor Watson details what the president calls the "Golden Dome."

title: Trump on Medicaid in budget bill; News on Biden's past cancer tests
description: President Trump traveled to Capitol Hill on Tuesday to push for House Republicans to pass his budget bill as conservative holdouts demand more changes. CBS News' Nancy Cordes and Nikole Killion have more on that and the latest news about President Biden's prostate cancer diagnosis.
